metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000017 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
phpMyAdmin 4.0, 4.4 and 4.6 are vulnerable to a weakness where a user withappropriate permissions is able to connect to an arbitrary MySQL server

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.6-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.6-5').
